title: More Than 104,000 NYC Students Were Homeless Last Year
description: The number of students in temporary housing rose by about 3 percent, a daunting figure that does not include the thousands of migrant children who have recently entered city schools.
dc:creator: Troy Closson
category: Advocates for Children of New York
media:credit: Stephen Speranza for The New York Times
media:description: Hannah Bernard hands out work sheets during class at P.S. 446, Riverdale Avenue Community School, where 15 percent of the students were homeless in the 2020-21 school year.
